contentrichtext.text: '''Viscount Goderich''' was a title that was created twice in British history. The first creation came in the [[Peerage of England]] in 1706 in favour of [[Henry Grey, 1st Duke of Kent|Henry Grey, 12th Earl of Kent]]. He was made Marquess of Kent at the same time and was further honoured when he was made [[Duke of Kent]] in 1710. All the titles became extinct on his death in 1740. For further information of this creation, see [[Duke of Kent]] (1710 creation). The second creation came in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]] in 1827 in favour of the Honourable [[F. J. Robinson, 1st Viscount Goderich|F. J. Robinson]]. He was a great-great-grandson of the first Duke of Kent. In 1833 he was further honoured when he was made Earl of Ripon. For further history of this creation, see [[Marquess of Ripon]]. ==Viscounts Goderich; First creation (1706)== *see [[Duke of Kent]] (1710 creation) ==Viscounts Goderich; Second creation (1827)== *see [[Marquess of Ripon]] ==References== *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Goderich}} [[Category:Viscounts in the Peerage of England]] [[Category:Viscounts in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]] {{England-viscount-stub}}
